intro: Pourretia joinvillei, commonly known as the Joinville's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow berries that are dispersed by birds. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
